column4: hey I recompiled all the alsa drivers and utils and everything so I know it's not an issue with that. I'm simply asking if I'm trying to follow the following tutorial does it matter that I'm on amd64 running 32 bit skype and 64bit jackd? (http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=577914)
that would probably be best asked on that forum thread
did you actually compile alsa drivers from source?
yeah. I used the script provided at: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?p=6589810
wow, thats really not recommended....
runs better than it used to..
well, I would recommend using one of those tutorial threads
compiling modules from source is really not the ubuntu way of doing things
yeah... well ubuntu is slow at releasing UP TO DATE drivers. soooo I do it my own way lol.
yes, it is now considered a dead project
yeah..well.. people like to use the power of ALSA rather than using crappy sound like pulse
I don't use ubuntu, I just hang out and help the linux newbs :)
lol nice
what distro you running?
gentoo
a bit of extra work but always up to date
good man lol. good os.. I WAS running it.. then i decided to try ubuntu... bad choice..
yeah, I think of ubuntu as mainly a starter distro
the gateway drug into linux :)
nice!
I tired fedora.. then I ran away lol tooo many bugs
I'm not a big fan of fedora/centos/red hat
noice! mind if I pm you a sec?
thats fine
